agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
site_name: REGION 14 - LEAD AGENCY - COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER INC.
service_name: COORDINATED ENTRY - COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER INC.
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Dearborn, Ohio, Ripley, or Switzerland County -- Currently and chronically homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing recovery advocacy services, including education, peer support, and a safe and supportive recovery community in southeastern Indiana.
service_description: Offers free naxolone, Deterra bags (illicit substance disposal), and fentanyl test trips to those in the community.
taxonomy_name: Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
site_details: Walk in and go to bins inside the lobby.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 11am-7pm; Sat noon-8pm; Sun noon-7pm -- HIV/Hepatitis C Tests: Monthly 1st Mon 12:30pm-2:30pm
Office: Mon-Fri 11am-7pm; Sat noon-8pm; Sun noon-7pm -- HIV/Hepatitis C Tests: Monthly 1st Mon 12:30pm-2:30pm
Office: Mon-Fri 11am-7pm; Sat noon-8pm; Sun noon-7pm -- HIV/Hepatitis C Tests: Monthly 1st Mon 12:30pm-2:30pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A hospital that offers a full-service medical facility, including diagnostic and treatment services, health care programs, and 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers financial payment options to those who are unable to pay their medical bills. The assistance may include financial assistance or payment plans based on income.
site_details: Call to request a financial assistance form be sent in the mail -OR- visit the website to download and print the form. Completed forms may be mailed, emailed, faxed, or dropped off in person. -- Processing time may take up to 30 days.
site_eligibility: Received medically necessary health care services from the hospital (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Has a remaining balance after insurance has processed the claim -OR- individuals who are uninsured

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering assistance to people in communities in southeast Indiana.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY CORPORATION - AURORA
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program for Franklin and Union County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list. Waiting list open Oct 3-Nov 16, 2022 until 4:30pm.
site_details: For new applications: Call to request an application. -- Waiting list is now closed.
site_eligibility: Household income below set limits -- Preference given to families with children, seniors, and people with disabilities

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides an overnight homeless shelter for individuals and families.
service_description: Offers shelter to homeless men, women, and families. Support services include job search assistance, budgeting and household management, counseling, and child care. Typical stays are up to three months, but may be longer depending on program availability and client need.
site_details: Call for availability and intake.
site_eligibility: Primarily serves individuals and families living within geographic area served but will serve individuals and families in emergency situations from surrounding counties as space allows -- Single or married men and women age 18 or older, with or without children. -- Unmarried couples are not accepted in the family rooms. (One partner may stay in individual dorms  as space allows.) -- Must complete a criminal background check and have no extreme violent or sexual charges

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing a range of mental health and addiction treatment services for Franklin, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
site_name: COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER - EMERGENCY SEVICES
service_description: Provides 24-hour phone crisis intervention for persons experiencing a mental health or addiction crisis. Crisis coordinators perform an assessment and then provide appropriate referrals to outpatient services, emergency rooms, pre-hospital screenings, or police contact for a wellness check. Current clients of this agency may use this line to get connected to the doctor-on-call for crisis assistance.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing a range of mental health and addiction treatment services for Franklin, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder, bi-polar disorder, depression, gambling treatment, post-traumatic stress disorder, or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Dearborn and Ohio County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8:30am-4:30pm Wed 8:30am-noon
site_eligibility: Veteran -- Surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit community-based clearinghouse with charitable outreach services, including clothing and food pantries; senior boxes; and homeless kits.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and homeless kits to those in need. The amount of groceries provided depends on the number of members in household. Homeless kits include backpack, blanket, tarp, socks, and toiletries. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Dearborn or Ohio County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A self-help program that uses the 12 step structure for people with a gambling addiction. Also offers support for families and friends that are affected by the gambling of others.
service_description: Offers a 12-Step self-help group for families and friends of compulsive gamblers. Gam-Anon meetings help members understand the gambling problem and its impact on their lives.
taxonomy_name: Families/Friends of Individuals With a Gambling Addiction Support Groups
nameLevel5: Families/Friends of Individuals With a Gambling Addiction Support Groups
site_details: Walk in; meetings held in second floor conference room. -- For information, call or email the national office.
site_schedule: Meeting time: Tues 10am-11am -- Customer service: Daily 24hrs
site_eligibility: Family and friends of person who are compulsive gamblers

agency_desc: A commercial network of Methadone, Suboxone, Buprenorphine, and Vivitrol clinics providing medication assisted therapy and counseling services for patients recovering from addiction.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to individuals who are addicted to opioid drugs (including opium, morphine, codeine products, heroin, oxycodone, and hydrocodone). Services include medication, counseling, education, and referrals to other agencies as needed.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call to schedule intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- In state of withdrawal at intake (not used opiates in the last 24-48 hours) - Note: This does NOT apply to pregnant women. -- Addicted to or dependent on opiates for a minimum of one year -- Without an active prescription for opiate medications -- Willing to submit to physical exam, drug testing, and urine specimen collection

agency_desc: A commercial company providing medication-assisted treatment (MAT) and other support services to those struggling with opioid dependence.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to persons with opioid drug dependence (including heroin, hydrocodone, morphine, and oxycodone). Services include counseling, group support sessions, and buprenorphine (Suboxone) treatment. Fixed fees due at time of service.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Intake: Daily 24 hours -- Service hours vary by location; see sites for more information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- With opioid dependence

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Dearborn, Decatur, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
service_description: Provides the least restrictive representation and services to incapacitated adults, both in the community and in institutions.
taxonomy_name: Residential Placement Services for People With Disabilities
nameLevel4: Residential Placement Services for People With Disabilities
site_details: Call to complete referral.
site_eligibility: 18 years of age or older -- incapable of making informed decisions -- lacks family and/or friends who are willing and/or able to provide assistance

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Dearborn, Decatur, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
service_description: Offers a hot meal, fellowship, entertainment, and activities to those over 60 years old.
site_details: Visit www.lifetime-resources.org/nutrition18 for location details. -- Reservations are required. -- Contact the location nearest you to make a reservation over the phone.
site_eligibility: 60 or older

agency_desc: A government organization that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental units in Dearborn County to seniors and persons with disabilities. Applications are currently being accepted for the waiting list.
site_details: Walk in or sent email for information.
site_eligibility: Low Income -- Priority given to persons 55 or older or those with disabilities -- US citizens or eligible immigrants

agency_name: DEARBORN COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
agency_desc: A government agency that provides recycling and household hazardous waste disposal in Dearborn County.
service_description: Offers a drive-through recycling center and 14 drop-off recycling locations. Hazardous waste is accepted at drive-though recycling center only.
site_details: Drop Off Services: Visit website for drop-off locations. -- Drive Through Services: Drive though during service hours.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; Drop Off Locations: Daily 24/7; Drive Through Recycling: Mon, Tues, Thus, and Fri 9am-4; Wednesday 9am-6pm
Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; Drop Off Locations: Daily 24/7; Drive Through Recycling: Mon, Tues, Thus, and Fri 9am-4; Wednesday 9am-6pm
site_eligibility: Residents of Dearborn County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Dearborn County.
service_description: Maintains the Dearborn County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Lawrenceburg in Dearborn County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Lawrenceburg in Dearborn County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in city of Lawrenceburg in Dearborn County.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignment, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.?
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK or K-12

agency_name: PREGNANCY CARE CENTER OF SOUTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: Provides various services for expectant and new parents which includes parenting classes, free pregnancy testing, and referrals to other community organizations
site_name: PREGNANCY CARE CENTER OF SOUTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Providing pregnancy care center services, including confidential support, free parenting classes, free emergency assistance, information and referral of family planning, pregnancy options, free pregnancy testing, and limited obstetrical ultrasounds.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, text, or visit website for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: PERSONAL TOUCH HOME CARE OF INDIANA
agency_desc: A commercial agency offering comprehensive services.
site_name: PERSONAL TOUCH HOME CARE OF INDIANA
service_description: Provides licensed physical and occupational therapists, as well as speech language pathologists for patient rehabilitation.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: DILLSBORO COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY AND THRIFT STORE
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing community outreach services, including a food pantry and thrift store.
site_name: DILLSBORO COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY AND THRIFT STORE
service_description: Provides essential food and personal hygiene items in emergency situations only. Pantry is unable to provide regular on-going assistance each month. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Clay or Caesar Township; verify township by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides a food and clothing pantry to all in need.
service_description: Providing food to those in need. Limited services area.
site_details: Re-verify required every six (6) months -- If visiting close to a holiday, check Facebook to verify normal hours.
site_schedule: Mon and Sat 9am-noon; Tues and Sun 5:30pm-7:30pm
site_eligibility: Living in the townships of Harrison, Jackson, Kelso, Logan, Miller, or York -- Limit one (1) visit every 14 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides equestrian therapy program for disabled individuals and children.
service_description: Provides therapeutic riding and equestrian therapy program for disabled individuals and children. Riding classes are available for individuals or groups.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Dearborn County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Tues 9am and 3rd Tues 5pm
Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Tues 9am and 3rd Tues 5pm

agency_desc: Treatment Center provider specialized behavioral health care service.
service_description: Provides substance abuse treatment services that can ensure successful recovery from heroin or other opioid addictions by offering effective medication like Methadone, Suboxone, Subutex, or Vivitrol. Individual and group therapy sessions are available.

taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment (If eligible, you will be admitted that day) -- Visit website for more information -OR- fill out contact form.

service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and internet access.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial agency provider of telecommunications products and services for southeastern Indiana.
service_description: Assists family in need to obtain broadband connectivity services. Eligible consumers can receive up to $9.25 per month in discounts.
site_details: Call for information or go to https://nationalverifier.servicenowservices.com/lifeline to start the eligibility process.
site_eligibility: Household in which someone participates in in Federal Public Housing Assistance or Section 8 -OR- Federal Veterans Pension - OR- SNAP benefits (Food Stamps) -OR- Medicaid -OR- Supplemental Security Income (SSI) - OR- Household income at or below 135% of federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: A government agency focused on the safety and well-being of the county's citizens and animals.
service_description: Provides animal control, animal adoption, animal licensing services and other domestic animal related services in Dearborn County Indiana
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of Lawrenceburg in Dearborn County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks for qualifying food items.

site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Greendale in Dearborn County.
service_description: Responds to fire and emergency medical situations in the city of Greendale in Dearborn County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. -- For non-emergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Government agency's primary purpose is to coordinate the response to a disaster that has occurred in Dearborn County
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Dearborn County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers sandbags to Dearborn County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Dearborn County

agency_desc: A county government office that provides property information.
service_description: Guides and reviews all land development including all land survey activities for the county.  Services include, but are not limited to maintaining section corners pertaining to land ownership, documenting all cemeteries, producing GIS maps, being the technical authority on drainage, storm-water management, and keeping our water clean. The Indiana Alcoholic Beverage Commission requires a state form to be signed by the Surveyor to verify the Business Location for ABC permits.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Dearborn County

agency_desc: A faith-based organization providing charitable outreach, including food and clothing pantry, and limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food; clothing pantry; and limited financial assistance with utilities to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Complete resource sheet with Southeastern Indiana Economic Opportunity Commission (SIEOC).
site_eligibility: Living in Dearborn, Ohio, Ripley, or Switzerland County -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit Chamber of Commerce that serves to foster economic development and build community strength within Dearborn County.
service_description: Lobbies for legislation that supports the interests of businesses in Fulton County. Offers membership benefits including advertisement, sponsorship, chamber newsletters, business referrals, online forums, and a Chamber Dollar Program. Provides networking opportunities and leadership programs for business leaders in Dearborn County.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Dearborn County business

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a residential group home for abused and neglected children, and to house runaways in need of help.
service_description: Provides housing services for neglected and abandoned children in a residential group home setting. Residents participate in learning daily living skills, goal setting, conflict resolution, daily chores and community service projects.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit website to apply.
site_eligibility: Indiana residents ages 12-20

agency_desc: A county organization that maintains an animal shelter, responds to reports of stray or neglected animals, and offers pet adoptions.
service_description: Provides animal control services, animal licenses, animal adoption, and spay and neuter services in Dearborn County
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, Thurs, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-4pm
Mon, Wed, Thurs, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-4pm
Mon, Wed, Thurs, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-4pm
Mon, Wed, Thurs, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-4pm
Mon, Wed, Thurs, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-4pm
site_eligibility: Animal Control: Dearborn County -- Animal Licenses and Spay/Neuter Services: Dearborn County -- Animal Adoption -- Open

agency_desc: Provides educational, informational, recreational, and personal needs of individuals of all ages.
service_description: The public library has boosted their WiFi to extend service to parking lots.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri, 10am-6pm; Tues and Thurs, 10am-8pm; Sat 10am-3pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides educational, informational, recreational, and personal needs of individuals of all ages.
service_description: Providing public library services; book readings, early literacy development programs, family literacy programs, and reference and information, for Dearborn County residents
site_details: Walk-ins accepted
site_eligibility: Dearborn county residents

agency_name: ALZHEIMER'S SUPPORT GROUPS OF SOUTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that assists caregivers with information and support through monthly meetings.
site_name: ALZHEIMER'S SUPPORT GROUPS OF SOUTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Offers support group that assist caregivers with information and support through monthly support group meetings.
site_details: Walk in or call to leave voicemail for return call within 24 hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Dearborn County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: A government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in the County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in the County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Dearborn County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Provides a monthly internet service discount of up to $30 for eligible households and up to $75 for eligible households on Tribal lands. Eligible households may also receive a one-time discount of up to $100 for a laptop, tablet, or desktop computer with the participant contributing $10-$50 towards the purchase price. Only one monthly service discount and one device discount allowed per household.
site_details: Call or send email for assistance in applying for the program.
site_eligibility: Living in Dearborn or Ohio County -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines -- Household member(s) already enrolled in certain government assistance programs such as SNAP, Medicaid, WIC, SSI, Veterans Pension and Survivors Benefit, Free and Reduced-Price School Lunch Program, US Department of Agriculture (USDA) Community Eligibility Provision, or Federal Pell Grant recipient in current award year -- Household member(s) already receiving Lifeline benefit -- Living on qualifying Tribal land

agency_name: CAESAR CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - DEARBORN COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: CAESAR CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - DEARBORN COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members
